Package de.db.derpate.servlet

Class LoginServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.db.derpate.servlet.BaseServlet
          • de.db.derpate.servlet.FilterServlet
            • de.db.derpate.servlet.LoginServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    @WebServlet("/login")
public class LoginServlet
extends FilterServlet
    This HttpServlet get's called by the client, when the user tries to log on. It checks the given credentials and redirects to the start page for logged in users.
    Allowed http methods: POST
    Author:
    MichelBlank
    See Also:
    LoginManager, Serialized Form

      static java.lang.String INPUT_FIELD_TOKEN
      Input field name for user to submit token code (Trainees)
      static int SC_ALREADY_LOGGED_IN
      Http status codes used to indicate that the session is already registered with a user and therefore cannot be used by another user.
      static int SC_LOGIN_ERROR
      Http status code used to indicate a bad login
      static int SC_LOGIN_INCOMPLETE
      Http status code used to indicate that not all required fields have been sent.

      Http status code used to indicate a successful login
      private static long serialVersionUID
      Default serial version UID
      private TraineeDao traineeDao  
      static @NonNull CSRFForm USERFORM
      CSRFForm, that this Servlet is for, used for the CSRF Filter and generating a new token, if username or password was wrong (but csrf token was correct)

      protected void onPost​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, @NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      This method serves the http post-method and receives the credentials provided by the client, checks them and redirects to the next page (or sends an http status code, to let the client know, that the login was not successful).

                      @NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method serves the http post-method and receives the credentials provided by the client, checks them and redirects to the next page (or sends an http status code, to let the client know, that the login was not successful).

      • attachCSRFHeader

        private static void attachCSRFHeader​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     @NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Attaches a header to the given HttpServletResponse, that the client can use for a new request
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpServletRequest containing the HttpSession of client
        response - the HttpServletResponse
        See Also:
        CSRFPreventionUtil.attachNewTokenToHttpResponse(HttpSession, HttpServletResponse, CSRFForm)
